lexUnit.name: offensive.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: causing resentment, displeasure, or hurt

sentence.text: The words on the pavement were common currency nowadays ; although Rita 's mother would have found them deeply offensive .
He found it deeply offensive to think of Alice-his beautiful Alice -- being rejected by anyone .
I have found the way I have been treated by qualified and unqualified people patronising and presumptuous and deeply offensive .
Entomology became more fashionable once better killing bottles provided the squeamish with a less offensive method of collecting specimens .
There followed as always , an uneasy compromise ; some of the more offensive wording was covered up .
On Malta the reduced Axis air activity as the last of the German aircraft departed Sicily allowed more offensive action to be put in hand .
But this year an even more offensive marketing ploy is keeping me away from my Christmas shopping .
While not condoning his more offensive behaviour over a career that spanned some 20 of the writer 's 30 years , Bellamy nevertheless offers an often ignored view of Connors ' early years .
This is more than a mere measure of the offensive character in question .
Tallis smelled blood and the more offensive stink of ordure .
She then made a most offensive and denigrating remark about my practice , and is probably doing the same thing to everyone else here . "
To me and , I 'm sure , to many others , the title above is far more offensive .
Gases are offensive , smells are offensive , grit and dust penetrate houses just as surely as toxic vapours and car fumes .
The discharge can be yellow , green , thick , offensive .
The word black in itself ca n't be offensive .
Millais 's painting of Christ in the House of his Parents was deeply offensive to Dickens , apparently because its workaday imperfections implied a far from Holy Family .
That kind of evil theatre crap is really offensive .
The organisers say current legislation is offensive to homosexuals and to lesbians .
The Air Staff were not slow to underline the Second World War 's lessons of air warfare : the need to win and to maintain air superiority by offensive air action .
With regret Stirling realized that he would have to abandon offensive action that night and decided to withdraw without placing any bombs , so as not to jeopardize a future visit .
Defence Secretary Malcolm Rifkind has warned any offensive ground action would involve more than 100,000 men and lead to heavy casualties .

And even then , the content and boundaries of the offensive behaviour are matters of administrative discretion .
In a sense , then , it is unnecessary from a practical point to distinguish between the various forms of offensive words or behaviour .
Racial harassment involves hostile or offensive behaviour towards an individual or group because of their race .
Whereas the other forms of offensive conduct may be by words or conduct , ` disorderly behaviour " is specified to be capable of commission by behaviour only .
Furthermore , even if the person warned did not repeat the conduct about which he had been warned , he could be arrested if he engaged in a different act or course of offensive conduct .
The chief aim is to reduce the solid volume of waste , offensive odours and to effect pathogen removal .
Higher environmental standards have to some extent highlighted the problem of offensive odours .
This has the advantage of apparently allowing storage of digested slurries without regeneration of offensive odours .
It would therefore be reasonable to consider whether children find it offensive to be treated like children .
A fat , smelly old harridan with a stick became quite offensive when Damien attempted to thrust his way to his rightful position at the front of the queue .

Apart from the general prohibition , Tyndale 's translations , especially the later ones , were found particularly offensive for their belligerent marginal glosses , which often followed those of Luther .
The chairman may seem brash , even offensive to some , but he 's turned the club on its head .
It had , in part , to do with the nature of separatism being highly offensive to those who held traditional broad left views .
In fact , English criminal law has a wide range of such offences , of which those involving firearms , offensive weapons , motor vehicles , and other endangerment will be outlined here .
Lower down the scale comes the offence of possessing an offensive weapon without lawful authority or excuse , contrary to the Prevention of Crime Act 1953 .
Brabin J. commented on the site chosen for the defendant 's premises which were used for fat rendering , an offensive trade .

Two men from London were charged with affray , criminal damage and possession of offensive weapons last night after the incident at The Bull in Camps Road .

Mark found the marble bathroom almost offensive .
